001package imagingbook.lib.math;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
005
006/**
007 * This code is volatile, don't use yet!
008 * 
009 * @author WB
010 * @version 2021/08/26
011 */
012public class ChiSquaredDistance {
013        
014        public static double distance(double[] P, double[] Q) {
015                if (P.length != Q.length) {
016                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors P, Q have different lengths");
017                }       
018                double sum = 0;
019                for (int i = 0; i < P.length; i++) {
020                        double denom = P[i] + Q[i];
021                        if (!isZero(denom)) {
022                                sum = sum + sqr(P[i] - Q[i]) / denom;
023                        }
024                }
025                return 0.5 * sum;
026        }
027        
028        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
029        
030        private static void testDistance(double[] P, double[] Q) {
031                System.out.println();
032                System.out.println("P = " + Matrix.toString(P));
033                System.out.println("Q = " + Matrix.toString(Q));
034                System.out.format("D(P,Q) = %.6f\n", distance(P, Q));
035                System.out.format("D(Q,P) = %.6f\n", distance(Q, P));
036                
037                System.out.format("D(P,P) = %.6f\n", distance(P, P));
038                System.out.format("D(Q,Q) = %.6f\n", distance(Q, Q));
039        }
040
041        public static void main(String[] args) {
042                {
043                        double[] P = {1, 2, 13, 5, 45, 23};
044                        double[] Q = {67, 90, 18, 79, 24, 98};
045                        testDistance(P, Q);
046                }       
047                {
048                        double[] P = {91, 900, 78, 30, 602, 813};
049                        double[] Q = {57, 49, 36, 759, 234, 928};
050                        testDistance(P, Q);
051                }
052                
053        }
054}
